riddle: Where waters mirror the sky and thoughts run deep, seek the clue where reflections sleep.
A guarded castle where few may stride, find the hint near the gate with pride.
Near where “F” begins its tale, sit where stories never fail.
I never walk yet show every way—read the arrows that choose your day.
Not the door of restless nights, but the glass that frames the lights.
Where doubts line up and answers are stamped, seek the desk where futures are camped.
Where hunger gathers but plates don’t yet meet, look just beyond where aromas greet.
Beneath what stands, where lost things wait, lies the answer delayed by fate.
Not in front but where effort hides, turn around where support resides.
Neither his nor hers alone, where every sign stands neutral in tone.
